main event: A witness observed a large rectangular cloud glowing in the sky, approximately 500 yards long, 500 yards wide, and 50 yards high, in New Zealand on July 12, 1951.
interesting points: The cloud was stationary before moving at a right angle towards the east,The cloud's main bulk remained motionless and was not clearly defined,The witness described the cloud as having the appearance of a whirlwind,The object was reported to have disappeared over the sea,The conclusion drawn by investigators was that it was probably a balloon.
witness description: The witness observed the cloud and provided a detailed report of its appearance and movements.
